titleStmt.title: Whereas Thomas Percy Gentleman, and some other his confederates, person knowen to be so vtterly corrupted with the superstition of the Romish religion ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie.,

notesStmt.note: For the apprehension of Percy, Robert Catesby, Ambrose Rookwood, Thomas Winter, Edward Grant, John and Christopher Wright, and Robert Ashfield.
Title from opening words of text.
Dated at end: Westminster, the seuenth day of Nouember, in the third yeere of our reigne ..
In this edition sheet 1 line 7 has: Clergie; sheet 2 line 7 ends: their.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
